subject: Business
title: Leadership vs. Management
description: Learn Leadership vs. Management in one minute.

hook.text: A manager makes sure the team climbs the ladder efficiently. A leader checks if the ladder is on the right wall.

buildup.text: Management is about processes, efficiency, and control. Leadership is about vision, change, and people.

discovery.text: John Kotter argued that most organizations are over-managed and under-led. They optimize but don't inspire.

twist.text: You need both. Pure leadership without management is chaos. Pure management without leadership is stagnation.

climax.text: The best leaders also manage, and the best managers also lead. The distinction matters most at the extremes.

punchline.text: Manage things. Lead people. Know the difference.

quiz.question: What is the key difference between leadership and management?
options: Leadership focuses on vision and people; management focuses on processes and efficiency
Leadership is for executives; management is for middle managers
Leadership and management are the same thing
